RedeemGiftCard.title: Gift Card Redeemable
RedeemGiftCard.description: Validate or redeem a gift card

gift.description: Contains information on the number of gift card credits that the customer wants to apply to the order.

credits.description: The number of credits that the user wants to use from the gift card to fulfill the order. The value of credits cannot be higher than the current balance on the gift card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

RedeemLoyaltyCard.title: Loyalty Card Redeemable
RedeemLoyaltyCard.description: Validate or redeem a loyalty card

reward.description: Contains information about the reward that the customer wants to redeem and the number of points the customer is choosing to use for the reward.

id.description: Unique reward ID assigned by Voucherify. The reward must be assigned to the campaign in order for the user to be able to use the reward.

points.description: The number of loyalty points that the user wants to spend in order to fulfill the order using a **pay with points** reward. The number of points cannot be higher than the current balance on the loyalty card.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

type.description: This parameter is required to establish a new session.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the session.ttl_unit parameter.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the redeeming customer.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the redemption.

amount.description:
For gift cards, this is a positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the number of redeemed credits.
For loyalty cards, this is the number of loyalty points used in the transaction.

redemption.description: Unique redemption ID of the parent redemption.

session.description: Contains details about the redemption session lock. Sessions can be established only for discount vouchers, promotions, and gift cards.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID sent in the request.

id.description: Unique rollback redemption ID.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

rollback_order_mode.description: Defines the rollback mode for the order. `WITH_ORDER` is a default setting. The redemption is rolled back together with the data about the order, including related discount values. `WITHOUT_ORDER` allows rolling the redemption back without affecting order data, including the applied discount values. This is returned only in GET `v1/redemptions/` and GET `v1/redemptions/{redemptionId}` endpoints.

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

failure_code.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a generic reason as to why the redemption failed.

failure_message.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a more expanded reason as to why the redemption failed.

items.description: Array of items applied to the order. It can include up to 500 items.

channel.description: Defines the details of the channel through which the redemption was issued.

channel_id.description: Unique channel ID of the user performing the redemption. This is either a user ID from a user using the Voucherify Dashboard or an X-APP-Id of a user using the API. For `AUTO_REDEEM`, it is the reward assignment ID.

channel_type.description: The source of the channel for the redemption. A `USER` corresponds to the Voucherify Dashboard, `API` corresponds to the API, and `AUTO_REDEEM` corresponds to a loyalty campaign reward that has been redeemed automatically.

related_object_id.description: Unique related object ID assigned by Voucherify, i.e. v_lfZi4rcEGe0sN9gmnj40bzwK2FH6QUno for a voucher.

promotion_tier.description: Contains details of the promotion tier and the parent campaign.

gift.description: Contains the amount subtracted from the gift card for the redemption.

amount.description: Amount subtracted from the gift card as a result of the redemption. The amount is expressed as the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

loyalty_card.description: Contains the number of points subtracted from the loyalty card for the redemption.

points.description: Number of points subtracted from the loyalty card as a result of the redemption.

VoucherWithStackingRulesTypeCategories.title: Voucher with categories and validation rules assignments
VoucherWithStackingRulesTypeCategories.description: This is an object representing a voucher with categories and validation rules assignments for **POST** `v1/qualifications`, **POST** `v1/redemptions`, and **POST** `v1/validations`.

VoucherHolder.title: Voucher Holder
VoucherHolder.description: This is an object representing a voucher holder.

Bundle.title: Bundle Details
Bundle.description: Determines how the bundle conditions are met by the customer's order items. The items in the order meet the bundle condition in the following way: SKU, then product, then collection.

quantity.description: Determines how many bundles are qualified. If there are missing bundle products, the value is `0`. If the bundle is qualified, the value is `1`. The maximum number of identified bundles can equal the number set in `limit`. Also defines the multiplier of the discount for `AMOUNT`, `PERCENT`, and `UNIT` discount types. To inform end-customers that more products can be added to meet additional bundles, compare this parameter with `limit`.

limit.description: Determines the maximum number of identified bundles. This also defines the maximum multiplier of the bundle discount.

identified.description: Determines products from the customer's order items that meet bundle conditions. SKUs meet the conditions for their product that is used in the bundle. Returns only the products and their quantity that meet the bundle.

items.description: Determines a product from the customer's order items that meets bundle conditions.

id.description: Unique identifier of the product or SKU that meets the bundle condition. This is an ID assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: Determines the type of the object that meets the bundle condition.

item_index.description: Number assigned to the order line item in accordance with the order sent in the request. It starts with `0` for the first order line item in the request.

item_quantity.description: Quantity of items that meet the bundle conditions. If the quantity in the order is higher than the quantity required by the bundle, this returns only the number that meets the bundle. For example, if the bundle requires `5` coffees, but the order includes `10` coffees, `item_quantity` returns `5`.

missing.description: Determines products, SKUs, or collections from the bundle that are missing in the customer's order items. Determines also the missing quantity. For collections, this means that order items do not include a sufficient number of items that belong to the collection. Not returned when all required bundle items are in the order.

items.description: Determines a product, SKU, or collection that is in bundle conditions, but is missing in the customer's order items. Determines also the missing quantity.

id.description: Unique identifier of the collection, product, or SKU that is missing in the customer's order items. This is an ID assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: Determines the type of the object that is missing in the customer's order items.

item_quantity.description: Quantity of items that are missing in the order items to meet the bundle conditions.

stacking_rules_type.description: The type of the stacking rule eligibility.

ValidationsRedeemableSkippedResultLimitE.title: Validations Redeemable Skipped Result Limit Exceeded
ValidationsRedeemableSkippedResultLimitE.description: Displayed when the `applicable_redeemables_limit` defined in the stacking rules is exceeded.

ValidationsRedeemableSkippedResultCatego.title: Validations Redeemable Skipped Result Category Limit Exceeded
ValidationsRedeemableSkippedResultCatego.description: Displayed when `applicable_redeemables_per_category_limit` defined in the stacking rules is exceeded

message.example: Applicable redeemables limit per category exceeded

ValidationsRedeemableSkippedResultRedeem.title: Validations Redeemable Skipped Result Redeemables Limit Exceeded
ValidationsRedeemableSkippedResultRedeem.description: Displayed when `applicable_exclusive_redeemables_limit` defined in the  stacking rules is exceeded.

ValidationsRedeemableSkippedResultRedeem.title: Validations Redeemable Skipped Result Redeemables Category Limit Exceeded
ValidationsRedeemableSkippedResultRedeem.description: Displayed when `applicable_exclusive_redeemables_per_category_limit` defined in the stacking rules is exceeded.

message.example: Applicable exclusive redeemables limit per category exceeded

ValidationsRedeemableSkippedResultExclus.title: Validations Redeemable Skipped Result Exclusion Rules Not Met
ValidationsRedeemableSkippedResultExclus.description: Displayed when the redeemable cannot be applied because the exclusion rules are not fulfilled.

message.example: Redeemable cannot be applied due to exclusion rules

ValidationsRedeemableSkippedResultPreced.title: Validations Redeemable Skipped Result Preceding Validation Failed
ValidationsRedeemableSkippedResultPreced.description: Displayed in the ALL application rule when one of the preceding redeeambles is `INAPPLICABLE`, so the rest becomes `SKIPPED`

message.example: Redeemable cannot be applied due to preceding validation failure

status.description: Indicates whether the redeemable can be applied or not applied based on the validation rules.

id.description: Redeemable ID, i.e. the voucher code.

object.description: Redeemable's object type.

items.description: Array of items applied to the order. It can include up to 500 items.

result.description: Specifies the redeemable's end effect on the order. This object is unique to each type of redeemable.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes in the form of key/value pairs assigned to the redeemable.

campaign_name.description: Campaign name. Displayed only if the `options.expand` is passed with a `redeemable` value in the validation request body.

campaign_id.description: Unique campaign ID assigned by Voucherify. Displayed only if the `options.expand` is passed with a `redeemable` value in the validation request body.

name.description: Name of the promotion tier. Displayed only if the `options.expand` is passed with a `redeemable` value in the validation request body.

6_res_applicable_to_object.title: Included  Items
6_res_applicable_to_object.description: Contains list of items that qualify in the scope of the discount. These are definitions of included products, SKUs, and product collections. These can be discounted.

data.description: Contains array of items to which the discount can apply.

total.description: Total number of objects defining included products, SKUs, or product collections.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of included objects.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about included products, SKUs, or product collections in a dictionary.

6_res_inapplicable_to_object.title: Excluded Items
6_res_inapplicable_to_object.description: Contains list of items that **do not** qualify in the scope of the discount. These are definitions of excluded products, SKUs, and product collections. These **CANNOT** be discounted.

data.description: Contains array of items to which the discount cannot apply.

total.description: Total number of objects defining excluded products, SKUs, or product collections.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of excluded objects.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about excluded products, SKUs, or product collections in a dictionary.

6_obj_order_object.title: Order object
6_obj_order_object.description: This is an object representing an order with calculated discounts applied using the voucher code.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_amount.title: Amount Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_amount.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_percent.title: Percent Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_percent.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

percent_off.description: The percent discount that the customer will receive.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_fixed.title: Fixed Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_fixed.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value. A fixed discounts sets a fixed total on cart or item(s) and then calculates the discount to apply.

effect.description:
Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.    
    
| **Effect** | **Definition** |
|---|---|
| **APPLY_TO_ORDER** | Sets the order total amount to the value of the fixed amount. The discount value is calculated during the redemption as it's a difference between the total amount of the customer's order and the fixed amount. |
| **APPLY_TO_ITEMS** | Sets a new price on items. The total discount amount is calculated during the redemption and it's a difference between the initial item price and the fixed amount. |

fixed_amount.description: Sets a fixed value for an order total or the item price. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. If the fixed amount is calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. As a result, if the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit.title: Unit Discount, single item
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit_mul.title: Unit Discount, multiple items
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit_mul.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_shipping.title: Shipping Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_shipping.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

id.description: Unique shipping "product" ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: "Product's" source ID.

6_res_session_lock_discount_voucher.title: Session Lock
6_res_session_lock_discount_voucher.description: Schema model for `session` lock object. The session object contains information about the session key that was used to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests.

type.description: This session locks the redemption **quantity** by 1.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the `session.ttl_unit` parameter.

6_res_session_lock_gift_card.title: Session Lock
6_res_session_lock_gift_card.description: Schema model for `session` lock object. The session object contains information about the session key that was used to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests.

type.description: This session locks the redemption **quantity** by 1 and the redemption **gift credits** specified within the request.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the `session.ttl_unit` parameter.

6_obj_order_object_apply_to_order.title: Order object - Effect: Apply to order
6_obj_order_object_apply_to_order.description: This is an object representing an order with calculated discounts applied using the voucher code.

id.description: Unique order ID, assigned by Voucherify. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

source_id.description: The merchant's order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

status.description: Order status. This parameter is returned if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body or if you send the request body parameter when defining an order in the request body. This parameter can be passed but it's not required for validation at all. It's used in the redemption process. Normally after the redemption is done, the order is automatically to a `PAID` status. To avoid such default behaviour, the user can pass any of the other status options and it will be set the order status after the redemption instead of the default `PAID`.

amount.description: Order amount before applying any discount.

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order.

total_amount.description:
Order amount after applying all the discounts.  
`total_amount` = `amount` - `total_discount_amount`

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied.

total_applied_discount_amount.description: This field sums up all order-level discounts applied to the order.

items.description: Array of order items that have been applied to the order. Each order item can show the effects of particular discounts on the item-level.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order_item`.

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

amount.description: Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`).

price.description: Unit price of an item. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`discount_amount`

product.description: This object stores more information about the related product.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique product identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a product. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

sku.description: This object stores more information about the related SKU.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique SKU identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a SKU. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the order. A set of key/value pairs that are att to an order object. Stores additional information about the order in a structured format.

customer.description: Object containing information about the customer that is making the purchase.

id.description: Unique customer identifier of the customer making the purchase. The ID is assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: Type of object represented by the `customer` object.

referrer.description: Object containing information about the referrer.

id.description: Unique referrer ID, who referred the customer making the purchase.

object.description: Type of object represented by the `referrer` object.

customer_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the customer making the purchase. The ID is assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order`.

6_res_session_lock_loyalty_card.title: Session Lock
6_res_session_lock_loyalty_card.description: Schema model for `session` lock object. The session object contains information about the session key that was used to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests.

type.description: This session locks the redemption **quantity** by 1 and the redemption **loyalty points** specified within the request.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the `session.ttl_unit` parameter.

6_req_session_lock_discount_code.title: Discount Code Session Lock
6_req_session_lock_discount_code.description: Schema model for `session` lock object. The session object is **required** to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests. If you only send the `type` parameter in the request, then by default the session lock will be established for 7 days. Read more on establishing a <!-- [validation session](..docs/guides/campaign_recipes/Locking-Validation-Session.md) -->[validation session](doc:locking-validation-session).

type.description: This parameter is **required** to establish a new session. The session locks the redemption **quantity** by 1.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the `session.ttl_unit` parameter.

6_req_validate_voucher_customer_id.title: Customer ID
6_req_validate_voucher_customer_id.description: You can pass the unique customer ID that was assigned by Voucherify.

id.description: The ID of an existing customer that will be linked to redemption in this request.

6_req_validate_voucher_customer_source_i.title: Customer Source ID
6_req_validate_voucher_customer_source_i.description: You can send the source ID that you used to create the customer in Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer who validates a voucher. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service. If you also pass a customer ID (unique ID assigned by Voucherify), the source ID will be ignored.

9_req_create_customer.title: Customer
9_req_create_customer.description: This is an object containing information about the customer.

source_id.description:
The merchant's customer ID if it is different from the Voucherify customer ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a customer ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service. 

Please note that if you would like your data to sync based on the `source_id` of the customer, you need to define the `source_id` upfront. You will not be able to change or update the `source_id` later on.

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object.

phone.description: Customer's phone number.  This parameter is mandatory when you try to send out codes to customers via an SMS channel.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. This metadata can be used for validating whether the customer qualifies for a discount or it can be used in building customer segments.

6_req_validate_voucher_order_id.description: You can pass the unique order ID that was assigned by Voucherify.

6_req_validate_voucher_order_source_id.description: You can send the source ID that you used to create the order in Voucherify.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

allOf.title: Order Customer And Referrer Ids Objects

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

6_req_session_lock_gift_card.title: Gift Card Session Lock
6_req_session_lock_gift_card.description: Schema model for `session` lock object. The session object is **required** to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests. If you only send the `type` parameter in the request, then by default the session lock will be established for 7 days. Read more on establishing a <!-- [validation session](..docs/guides/campaign_recipes/Locking-Validation-Session.md) -->[validation session](doc:locking-validation-session).

type.description: This parameter is **required** to establish a new session. The session locks the redemption **quantity** by 1 and the redemption **gift credits** specified within the request.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the `session.ttl_unit` parameter.

6_req_session_lock_loyalty_card.title: Loyalty Card Session Lock
6_req_session_lock_loyalty_card.description: Schema model for `session` lock object. The session object is **required** to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests. If you only send the `type` parameter in the request, then by default the session lock will be established for 7 days. Read more on establishing a <!-- [validation session](..docs/guides/campaign_recipes/Locking-Validation-Session.md) -->[validation session](doc:locking-validation-session).

type.description: This parameter is **required** to establish a new session. The session locks the redemption **quantity** by 1 and the redemption **loyalty points** specified within the request.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the `session.ttl_unit` parameter.

7_obj_redemption_object_discount_voucher.title: Discount Voucher
7_obj_redemption_object_discount_voucher.description:
This is an object representing a redemption.  

Redemption is the key operation in the voucher and promotion tier lifecycle. A customer can redeem a voucher or promotion tier once or multiple times depending on selected limit (`quantity`). Each redemption is recorded in voucher/promotion's history (`redemption_entries`). There is also an option to cancel a redemption. We call such operation a <!-- [redemption rollback](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1redemptions~1{redemptionId}~1rollback/post) -->[redemption rollback](rollback-redemption).

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the `redemption`.

date.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 format indicating when the redemption occured.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the redeeming customer.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes in the form of key/value pairs assigned to the redemption.

order.description: Defines the details of the order that is related to the redemption.

channel.description: Defines the details of the channel through which the redemption was issued.

channel_id.description: Unique channel ID of the user performing the redemption. This is either a user ID from a user using the Voucherify Dashboard or an X-APP-Id of a user using the API.

channel_type.description: The source of the channel for the redemption. A `USER` corresponds to the Voucherify Dashboard and an `API` corresponds to the API.

customer.description: Defines the customer that is related to the redemption.

id.description: The unique ID of a customer that is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's customer ID if it is different from the Voucherify customer ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a customer ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format.

object.description: Type of object represented is `customer`.

related_object_type.description:
Defines the related object.

| **Related Object** | **Definition** |
| :--- | :--- |
| voucher | Either a discount voucher, gift card, or loyalty card. |

related_object_id.description: Unique related object ID assigned by Voucherify, i.e. v_lfZi4rcEGe0sN9gmnj40bzwK2FH6QUno for a voucher.

voucher.description: Defines the details of the voucher being redeemed.

7_obj_redemption_object_loyalty_card_ext.title: Loyalty Card Voucher
7_obj_redemption_object_loyalty_card_ext.description:
This is an object representing a redemption.  

Redemption is the key operation in the voucher and promotion tier lifecycle. A customer can redeem a voucher or promotion tier once or multiple times depending on selected limit (`quantity`). Each redemption is recorded in voucher/promotion's history (`redemption_entries`). There is also an option to cancel a redemption. We call such operation a <!-- [redemption rollback](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1redemptions~1{redemptionId}~1rollback/post) -->[redemption rollback](rollback-redemption).

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the redemption.

date.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 format indicating when the redemption occured.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the redeeming customer.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes in the form of key/value pairs assigned to the redemption.

amount.description: Number of points being redeemed for a reward.

order.description: Defines the details of the order that is related to the redemption.

channel.description: Defines the details of the channel through which the redemption was issued.

channel_id.description: Unique channel ID of the user performing the redemption. This is either a user ID from a user using the Voucherify Dashboard or an X-APP-Id of a user using the API.

channel_type.description: The source of the channel for the redemption. A `USER` corresponds to the Voucherify Dashboard and an `API` corresponds to the API.

customer.description: Defines the customer redeeming the reward.

id.description: The unique ID of a customer that is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's customer ID if it is different from the Voucherify customer ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a customer ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format.

object.description: Type of object represented is `customer`.

related_object_id.description: Unique related object ID assigned by Voucherify, i.e. `v_lfZi4rcEGe0sN9gmnj40bzwK2FH6QUno` for a voucher.

voucher.description: Defines the details of the voucher being redeemed.

loyalty_card.description: Stores the number of points being subtracted from the loyalty card for the reward redemption.

points.description: Number of points being subtracted from the loyalty card for the reward redemption.

7_obj_redemption_object_gift_card_extend.title: Gift Card
7_obj_redemption_object_gift_card_extend.description: This is an object representing a gift card redemption.

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

customer.description: Defines the customer redeeming the gift card.

id.description: The unique ID of a customer that is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's customer ID if it is different from the Voucherify customer ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a customer ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format.

gift.description: Contains the amount being subtracted from the gift card for the redemption.

The merchant's publication ID if it is different from the Voucherify publication ID. It's an optional tracking identifier of a publication. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a publication ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.
If `source_id` is provided only 1 voucher can be published per request.

customer.description: Contains information about the customer to whom the publication was directed.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the publication. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a publication object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the publication in a structured format.

name.description: Name of voucher's parent campaign or unique campaign ID that was assigned by Voucherify.

count.description: Number of vouchers to be published to customer.

It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a publication ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

Voucher.title: Voucher
Voucher.description: This is an object representing a voucher with categories and validation rules assignments.

sku_id.description: Unique identifier of the SKU. It is assigned by Voucherify.

product_id.description: Unique identifier of the product. It is assigned by Voucherify.

related_object.description: Used along with the source_id property, can be set to either sku or product.

source_id.description: The merchant's product/SKU ID (if it is different from the Voucherify product/SKU ID). It is useful in the integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database, or a third-party service.

quantity.description: The quantity of the particular item in the cart.

initial_quantity.description: A positive integer in the smallest unit quantity representing the total amount of the order; this is the sum of the order items' quantity.

amount.description: The total amount of the order item (price * quantity).

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-item-level discounts applied to the order.

initial_amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

price.description: Unit price of an item. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

product.description: An object containing details of the related product.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's product ID (if it is different than Voucherify's product ID). It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database or a 3rd party service.

override.description: The override set to `true` is used to store the product information in the system. If the product does not exist, it will be created with a source_id; if it does exist, the provided values for the name, price, and metadata will replace those already stored in the system. Override works only for endpoints that create an order in the database.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a product. It can be useful for storing additional information about the product in a structured format. It can be used to create product collections.

price.description: Product price. A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

sku.description: An object containing details of the related SKU.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's SKU ID (if it is different than Voucherify's SKU ID). It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database or a 3rd party service.

override.description: The override set to `true` is used to store the product information in the system. If the product does not exist, it will be created with a source_id; if it does exist, the provided values for the name, price, and metadata will replace those already stored in the system.

price.description: SKU price. A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order item. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order item in a structured format. It can be used to create product collections.

A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order item. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order item in a structured format. It can be used to define business validation rules.

QualificationsRedeemableBase.title: Single redeemable
QualificationsRedeemableBase.description: Data of single redeemable which was properly qualified.

id.description: Id of the redeemable.

object.description: Object type of the redeemable.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

items.description: Array of items applied to the order. It can include up to 500 items.

validation_rule_id.description: A unique validation rule identifier assigned by the Voucherify API. The validation rule is verified before points are added to the balance.

applicable_to.description: Contains list of items that qualify in the scope of the discount. These are definitions of included products, SKUs, and product collections. These can be discounted.

inapplicable_to.description: Contains list of items that do not qualify in the scope of the discount. These are definitions of excluded products, SKUs, and product collections. These CANNOT be discounted.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the product. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a product object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the product in a structured format.

banner.example: Order Paid - You will get 100 points
banner.description: Name of the earning rule. This is displayed as a header for the earning rule in the Dashboard.

campaign_name.description: Name of the campaign associated to the redeemable. This field is available only if object is not `campaign`

campaign_id.description: Id of the campaign associated to the redeemable. This field is available only if object is not `campaign`

ValidityTimeframe.title: Validity Timeframe
ValidityTimeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the earning rule is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time an earning rule will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, an earning rule with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, an earning rule with an `interval` of `P2D` will be valid every other day.

ValidityDayOfWeek.title: Validity Day Of Week
ValidityDayOfWeek.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the voucher is valid.

- `0` Sunday
- `1` Monday
- `2` Tuesday
- `3` Wednesday
- `4` Thursday
- `5` Friday
- `6` Saturday

ValidityHours.title: Validity Hours
ValidityHours.description: Determines the hours of validity, e.g. to create a happy hours scenario.

daily.description: Defines the reccuring period(s) when the resource is active. The periods should not overlap.

items.description: Defines the reccuring period(s) when the resource will be active.

start_time.description: Defines the starting hour of validity in the HH:mm format. The resource is *inactive before* this time.

days_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the resource is valid.

- `0` Sunday
- `1` Monday
- `2` Tuesday
- `3`  Wednesday
- `4` Thursday
- `5` Friday
- `6` Saturday

expiration_time.description: Defines the ending hour of validity in the HH:mm format. The resource is *inactive after* this time.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about validation rule assignments.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the JSON property that contains the array of validation rule assignments.

data.description: A dictionary that contains an array of validation rule assignments.

total.description: Total number of validation rule assignments.

Category.title: Category
Category.description: This is an object representing a category.

id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

hierarchy.description: Category hierarchy. Categories with lower hierarchy are processed before categories with higher hierarchy value.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the category.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

id.description: Unique identifier of an existing customer. It is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that are attached to the customer. It stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

assignment_id.description: Unique reward assignment ID assigned by Voucherify.

loyalty_tier_id.description: Unique loyalty tier ID assigned by Voucherify.

id.description: Unique reward ID.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the redemption was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 format indicating when the reward was updated.

parameters.description: These are parameters representing a material reward.

campaign.description: Defines the product redeemed as a reward.

id.description: Campaign unique ID.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

type.description: Defines the type of the campaign.

product.description: Defines the product redeemed as a reward.

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: Unique identifier of the SKU. It is assigned by Voucherify.

coin.description: Defines the ratio by mapping the number of loyalty points in `points_ratio` to a predefined cash amount in `exchange_ratio`.

exchange_ratio.description: The cash equivalent of the points defined in the `points_ratio` property.

points_ratio.description: The number of loyalty points that will map to the predefined cash amount defined by the `exchange_ratio` property.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a reward. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the reward.

VoucherBase.title: Voucher Base
VoucherBase.description: This is an object representing a voucher.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

gift.description: Object representing gift parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `GIFT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtracted_amount.description: Total amount of subtracted credits over the gift card lifetime. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

balance.description: Available funds. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

loyalty_card.description: Object representing loyalty card parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `LOYALTY_CARD`. Defaults to `null`.

points.description: Total number of points added to the loyalty card over its lifespan.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

pending_points.description: Shows the number of pending points that will be added to the loyalty card when they are activated automatically or manually.

expired_points.description: Shows the total number of expired points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

subtracted_points.description: Shows the total number of subtracted points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

holder_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the redeemable holder. It equals to the customer ID assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique identifier of the referring person.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `voucher`.

publish.description: Stores a summary of publication events: an event counter and endpoint to return details of each event. Publication is an assignment of a code to a customer, e.g. through a distribution.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the `url` attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of publications can be accessed using a **GET** method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/publications`

redemption.description: Stores a summary of redemptions that have been applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

redeemed_quantity.description: How many times a voucher has already been redeemed.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the url attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of redemptions can be accessed using a **GET** method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/redemptions`

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about validation rules assignments.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of validation rules assignments.

data.description: Contains array of validation rules assignments.

total.description: Total number of validation rules assignments.

data.description: Contains array of items to which the discount can apply.

total.description: Total number of objects defining included products, SKUs, or product collections.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

data_ref.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

data.description: Contains array of items to which the discount cannot apply.

total.description: Total number of objects defining included products, SKUs, or product collections.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

data_ref.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

RedeemableResultVoucherCode.title: Coupon Code
RedeemableResultVoucherCode.description: This is a `result` object representing the results for a coupon code.

discount.description: Discount details about the type of discount to be applied for the redeemable.

6_obj_order_object_apply_to_items.title: Order object - Effect: Apply to items
6_obj_order_object_apply_to_items.description: This is an object representing an order with calculated discounts applied using the voucher code.

id.description: Unique order ID, assigned by Voucherify. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

source_id.description: The merchant's order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

status.description: Order status. This parameter is returned if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body or if you send the request body parameter when defining an order in the request body. This parameter can be passed but it's not required for validation at all. It's used in the redemption process. Normally after the redemption is done, the order is automatically to a `PAID` status. To avoid such default behaviour, the user can pass any of the other status options and it will be set the order status after the redemption instead of the default `PAID`.

amount.description: Order amount before applying any discount.

items_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied.  
`sum(items, i => i.discount_amount)`

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of all product-specific discounts applied.

total_amount.description:
Order amount after applying all the discounts.  
`total_amount` = `amount` - `total_discount_amount`

items_applied_discount_amount.description: Product-specifc discounts applied to all the items.

total_applied_discount_amount.description: Product-specific discounts applied in the order.

items.description: Array of order items that have been applied to the order. Each order item can show the effects of particular discounts on the item-level.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order_item`.

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

amount.description: Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`).

discount_amount.description: The item-level discount applied to the item.

applied_discount_amount.description: The item-level discount applied to the item.

price.description: Unit price of an item. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`discount_amount`

product.description: This object stores more information about the related product.

object.description: Type of object represented by the `referrer` object.

VoucherAssets.description: Stores links to images of QR and barcode that correspond to an encrypted voucher code.

URL to QR code  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

URL to barcode  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

object.description: This object stores information about the resource to which the discount is applicable.

source_id.description: The source identifier from your inventory system.

product_id.description: Parent product's unique ID assigned by Voucherify.

product_source_id.description: Parent product's source ID from your inventory system.

price.description: New fixed price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 price is written as 1000. In case of the fixed price being calculated by the formula, i.e. the price_formula parameter is present in the fixed price definition, this value becomes the fallback value. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed price.

price_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the discounted price of an item.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

quantity_limit.description: The maximum number of units allowed to be discounted per order line item.

aggregated_quantity_limit.description: The maximum number of units allowed to be discounted combined across all matched order line items.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount per order line item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

aggregated_amount_limit.description:
Maximum discount amount per order. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount on the entire order is written as 600. This value is definable for the following discount effects:
- `APPLY_TO_ITEMS` (each item subtotal is discounted equally)
- `APPLY_TO_ITEMS_BY_QUANTITY` (each unit of matched products has the same discount value)

order_item_indices.description: Lists which order lines are (not) covered by the discount. The order in the array is determined by the sequence of applied discounts, while the numbers correspond to the order lines sent in the `order` object in the request. The first order line is assigned `0`, the second order line is assigned `1`, and so on.

order_item_units.description: Lists which units within order lines are covered by the discount. The order line items are listed according to sequence of applied discounts while the `index` corresponds to the order line sent in the `order` object in the request.

index.description: Number assigned to the order line item in accordance with the order sent in the request.

units.description: Numbers of units in the order line covered by the discount; e.g. `2, 5, 8` for 10 units with the setting `"skip_initially": 1`, `"repeat": 3`. The counting of units starts from `1`. The maximum quantity of all handled units is 1000. If the quantity of all order items exceeds 1000, this array is not returned, but `units_limit_exceeded: true`. However, the discount is calculated properly for all relevant units.

units_limit_exceeded.description: Returned as `true` only when the sum total of `quantity` of all order items exceeds 1000.

repeat.description: Determines the recurrence of the discount, e.g. `"repeat": 3` means that the discount is applied to every third item.

skip_initially.description: Determines how many items are skipped before the discount is applied.

target.description: Determines to which kinds of objects the discount is applicable. `ITEM` includes products and SKUs. `UNIT` means particular units within an order line.

7_obj_order_object_apply_to_order.title: Order object - Effect: Apply to order
7_obj_order_object_apply_to_order.description: This is an object representing an order with calculated discounts applied using the voucher code.

id.description: Unique order ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

amount.description: Order amount before applying any discount.

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order.

total_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied to the order.  
`total_discount_amount` = `discount_amount` + `items_discount_amount`

total_amount.description:
Order amount after applying all the discounts.  
`total_amount` = `amount` - `total_discount_amount`

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied.

total_applied_discount_amount.description: This field sums up all order-level and all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request.

items.description: Array of order items that have been applied to the order. Each order item can show the effects of particular discounts on the item-level.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order_item`.

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

amount.description: Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`).

price.description: Unit price of an item. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`discount_amount`

product.description: This object stores more information about the related product.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique product identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a product. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

sku.description: This object stores more information about the related SKU.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique SKU identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a SKU. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the order. A set of key/value pairs that are att to an order object. Stores additional information about the order in a structured format.

customer.description: Object containing information about the customer that is making the purchase.

id.description: Unique customer identifier of the customer making the purchase. The ID is assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: Type of object represented by the `customer` object.

referrer.description: Object containing information about the referrer.

id.description: Unique referrer ID, who referred the customer making the purchase.

object.description: Type of object represented by the `referrer` object.

customer_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the customer making the purchase. The ID is assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order`.

redemptions.description: Lists details related to the redemption.

source_id.description: The merchant's order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

amount.description: Order amount before applying any discount.

items_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied to the order.  
`sum(items, i => i.discount_amount)`

total_amount.description:
Order amount after applying all the discounts.

items_applied_discount_amount.description: Sum of all product-specific discounts applied.

7_obj_redemption_object_loyalty_card_dig.title: Discount Voucher
7_obj_redemption_object_loyalty_card_dig.description: Contains information about the source of the digital reward.

id.description: Unique parent campaign ID of reward.

7_obj_redemption_object_loyalty_card_dig.title: Gift Card
7_obj_redemption_object_loyalty_card_dig.description: Contains information about the source of the digital reward.

id.description: Unique parent campaign ID of reward.

balance.description: The amount credited to the gift card as a reward expressed as the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

7_obj_redemption_object_loyalty_card_dig.title: Loyalty Card
7_obj_redemption_object_loyalty_card_dig.description: Contains information about the source of the digital reward.

id.description: Unique parent campaign ID of reward.

balance.description: The number of loyalty points that is added to the loyalty card as a reward.

points.description: Customer's loyalty points minus expired for all loyalty cards which the customer has.

referred_customers.description: Total number of customers referred by the customer.

campaigns.description: Contains campaigns with details about point balances and how many customers were referred by the customer.

additionalProperties.description: Contains details about the point balances left on loyalty cards and the number of referred customers in each campaign.

loyalty_tier.description: Customer's loyalty tier within the campaign.

referred_customers.description: Number of customers referred by the customer in campaign.

CustomerReferrals.title: Customer Referrals
CustomerReferrals.description: Summary of customer's referrals, in this case, the customer being the referee, i.e. information about the source of referrals and number of times the customer was referred by other customers.

total.description: Total number of times this customer received a referral, i.e. was referred by another customer.

campaigns.description: Contains an array of campaigns that served as the source of a referral for the customer.

items.title: Customer Referrals Campaigns Item
items.description: Contains information about the source of the referral.

campaign_id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique referrer ID, assigned by Voucherify. This is the customer ID of a customer that is referring this customer.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was referred in ISO 8601 format.

RedeemableGift.title: Redeemable Gift
RedeemableGift.description: Contains current gift card balance information.

balance.description: Available funds. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

credits.description: The number of credits that the user wants to use from the gift card to fulfil the order. The value of credits cannot be higher than the current balance on the gift card. If the user gives more points than he has on the gift card, the application will return an error code in response. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

locked_credits.description: The number of credits that are locked under a validation session. This is returned if the qualification request includes `session.type: LOCK` parameter in the body. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000` for `$100.00`. Returns `0` if there aren't any active validation sessions for the gift card.

points.description: Total number of points added to the loyalty card over its lifespan.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

exchange_ratio.description: The cash equivalent of the points defined in the points_ratio property.

points_ratio.description: The number of loyalty points that will map to the predefined cash amount defined by the exchange_ratio property.

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Product's source ID.

id.description: Unique SKU ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Product variant's source ID.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the number of units.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

id.description: Unique product ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Unique product source ID.

price.description: Unit price. It is represented by a value multiplied by 100 to accurately reflect 2 decimal places, such as `$100.00` being expressed as `10000`.

attributes.description: A list of product attributes whose values you can customize for given SKUs: `["color","size","ranking"]`. Each child SKU can have a unique value for a given attribute.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the product. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a product object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the product in a structured format. It can be used to create product collections.

image_url.description: The HTTPS URL pointing to the .png or .jpg file that will be used to render the product image.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the product was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the product was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the product.
The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about SKUs.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the JSON property that contains the array of SKUs.

data.description: A dictionary that contains an array of SKUs.

total.description: Total number of SKUs in the product.

10_obj_order_object_unstacked_redemption.title: Unstacked Redemption
10_obj_order_object_unstacked_redemption.description: Redemption object representing a single redemption.

redemption_ID.description: The property name is the unique redemption ID; i.e. `r_0ba186c4824e4881e1`. This object contains information about the redemption of an incentive.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the redemption was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

related_object_id.description: Unique ID of the related object that defines the incentive.

related_object_parent_id.description: Represent's the campaign ID of the voucher if the redemption was based on a voucher that was part of bulk codes generated within a campaign. In case of a promotion tier, this represents the campaign ID of the promotion tier's parent campaign.

total_redeemed.description: Total number of redemptions made by the customer.

total_failed.description: Total number of redemptions that failed.

total_succeeded.description: Total number of redemptions that succeeded.

total_rolled_back.description: Total number of redemptions that were rolled back for the customer.

total_rollback_failed.description: Total number of redemption rollbacks that failed.

total_rollback_succeeded.description: Total number of redemption rollbacks that succeeded.

redeemed_amount.description: Total amount of gift card credits redeemed by customer. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

amount_to_go.description: Remaining gift card balance across all gift cards. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

redeemed_points.description: Total number of loyalty points redeemed by the customer.

points_to_go.description: Sum of remaining available point balance across all loyalty cards.

CustomerSummaryOrders.title: Customer Summary Orders
CustomerSummaryOrders.description: Lists details about orders related to the customer. Lists only data for orders with the `PAID` or `FULFILLED` status. Data from orders with a `CREATED` or `CANCELED` status are not included. The data is updated also when an order changes status.

total_amount.description: The total amount spent by the customer. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

total_count.description: Total number of orders made by the customer.

average_amount.description: Average amount spent on orders. `total_amount` ÷ `total_count`. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

last_order_amount.description: Amount spent on last order. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

last_order_date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time of the customer's last order in ISO 8601 format.

code.description: Unique loyalty card code from which the user wants to transfer loyalty points (source).

points.description: The number of loyalty points that the user wants to transfer to another loyalty card. The number of points cannot be higher than the current balance on the loyalty card (source).

source_id.description: The merchant's transaction ID if it is different from the Voucherify transaction ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a transaction ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

origin.name: origin
origin.description: Indicates the origin (scheme, hostname, and port).

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.description: Metadata key value pairs.
